title: Didone typeface suggestions
content:
Hello, first post here! Long time reader...

I am looking for a typeface that is similar to Didot, Bodoni, Clarendon (modern, ball terminals, a lot of weight variation) but a little more eccentric and irregular.

Any suggestions?

 [‹ LCM Grid?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003749/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50206 "Go to previous forum topic") [Suggestions for Cute Font. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003749/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50233 "Go to next forum topic")
author: general_salt

comments.content:
Perhaps [Squidot](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003749/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49685)?  
That may be too quirky and unavailable, but I like it.

Seems like this was asked recently, but can’t find the thread. Have a look at [Stilla](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003749/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/stilla_std_regular/), [Carousel](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003749/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/carousel_regular/), and more [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003749/http:/typographica.org/001077.php).

try [Perla](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010003749/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/795-Perla) — it’s on the eccentric end of things for sure.
